intro: Craterostigma gossweileri, commonly known as the desert rockcress, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and succulent leaves. The plant is highly drought-tolerant, adapting to harsh desert conditions through its deep root system and waxy leaf coatings. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, allowing it to colonize rocky and sandy soils. Craterostigma gossweileri plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
